articles.author: Jacqueline Howard, Lauren Mascarenhas, Jamie Gumbrecht and Maggie Fox, CNN
articles.title: Quick OK of first US Covid-19 vaccine cut no corners, FDA officials promise
articles.description: The very fast decision to grant emergency use authorization to the first coronavirus vaccine in the United States cut no corners and was based on a deep review of safety and efficacy data, two top US Food and Drug Administration officials said Saturday.

articles.title: Will Elon Musk's move to Texas affect Tesla brand?
articles.description: Could Elon Musk's relocation from California to Texas impact his brand? Will he lose his progressive base or win over conservatives?

articles.title: Smerconish: This is what Supreme Court should have done
articles.description: CNN's Michael Smerconish argues that President Trump was always going to lose the Texas lawsuit challenging President-elect Biden's win, but the Supreme Court did not go far enough in its explanation why.

articles.title: Iran executes dissident journalist Rouhollah Zam
articles.description: Dissident Iranian journalist Rouhollah Zam was hanged in Iran on Saturday morning, according to state television IRIB.

articles.description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks political ads on both sides of the aisle in the Georgia runoff elections. The races will determine control of the US Senate.

articles.description: Faithless electors have never had an impact on the outcome of an election, but they have occurred over the years. Here's how it works.

articles.description: Michael Phelps, who retired as the most decorated Olympian in history in 2016, is not holding out much hope for a clean Olympics Games in Tokyo next year.
